newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - July 21.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - July 21.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Australis shares rose another 1.5 cents on Friday, taking its rise in the last two trading days to 48 percent as speculation mounts that Australis is about to announce a merger with New Corp's and Telstra's pay television joint venture Foxtel. Australis held a board meeting on Friday and an announcement is expected this week.

Australian Provincial Newspapers Holdings Ltd (APN) and More Group Plc on Friday announced plans for an Asia-Pacific joint venture to provide street furniture called Adshel Street Furniture Pty Ltd. Adshel will buy APN's street furniture assets and contracts, including Australian Posters, plus APN's recently completed acquisition of three smaller street furniture companies UDF and ABS in Sydney and Citysites.

Savage Resources Ltd lost its bid for Peruvian state-owned miner Mahr Tunel to Peru's Volcan, which paid U$127 million and a investment commitment of at least $60 million over five years. Volcan, a mid-sized company, beat the $61 million offer from Savage Resources Ltd and Peru's Morococha, and an $85 million offer from Sweden's Boliden BOLi.TO. Both those bidders also offered investment of more than $60 million.

Television operator Seven Network Ltd said on Friday that it would raise A$325 million from a two-pronged capital raising involving an equity raising in Australia and a debt placement in the United States. The company said as part of the raising it had completed the placement of 13.8 million shares with institutional and other investors at A$5.43 per share, raising A$75 million.

Gaming machine maker Aristocrat Leisure Ltd said on Friday that it disagreed with a critical interim ruling by the Colorado Gaming Control Commission and would conduct a challenge at a full hearing late next month. Aristocrat general counsel Louise Sexton said she would not details the concerns which led to the latest ruling.
